page.title: 06WITLEY COURT _ DUDLEY ERA
page.content: In{1837,}owing to heavy debts, the estate was sold to the trustees of the eleventh{Baron Ward,}for Â£890,000 From{1843-1846}the house was occupied by{Queen Adelaide}dowager of King William IV.After her departure, Lord Ward came to live at Witley Court and remodelled the court and its grounds and restored the church at a cost of Â£250,000. The architect,{Samuel {Daukes,}added the crescent south wing and orangery. Both house and church were encased in Bath stone, a corniced balustrade was added to the roof and the towers were similarly altered to an Italian style. New stables were built to the south of the churchyard. The garden was laid out by{William {Nesfield,}with the central feature a large fountain based on the theme Perseus & Andromeda carved from Portland stone by{James Forsyth.
